folder: Stewart Avenue & Watchogue Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
Stewart Avenue, east side, 100 yards south of Watchogue Road, showing the old Vreeland House. Before Stewart Avenue was laid out the entrance to the house and farm was from Watchogue Road.

About 1900

By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
441 Watchogue Avenue, at the N.W. corner of Stewart Avenue, showing the Pero House, a colonial home. The walls are two feet thick. (For additional data see other views.)
Spring, 1924

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same, another view.
1924

folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
441 Watchogue Road, adjoining the N.W. corner of Stewart Avenue (formerly Willowbrook Road), showing the Pero House, dating back to colonial times. The house derives its name from Peter Pero, who distinguished himself in the Civil War. The property was bought by Garret Cruser in 1739; Daniel Winant owned it in 1839; William H. Pero bought it in 1878. It is also referred to as the Pero Christopher House.

P.L. Sperr

June 18, 1938.

(2)
Another view, a cross Watchogue Road.

P.L. Sperr

June 18, 1938.

folder: Watchogue Road & Stewart Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Pero-Christopher House, 441 Watchogue Avenue, n.w. cor. Stewart Avenue, Staten Island. Its stone walls are two feet thick.

n.d.

Acquired from the New York Herald Tribune morgue, 1948. 48X482
